item.title: Fix console logs for Azure Functions running in a Docker container
item.description: Local development of C# Azure Functions on macOS is still a bit painful. Even the simple-ish logging might cause issues. Let’s assume that we have Azure Functions Core Tools installed and we have a basic function app with one TimerTrigger function created. With the default Run/Debug configuration We can compile and run our function Our function will start and log to console as expected. I wish all the functions were that simple, right?

item.title: Provision your Azure environment with Terraform and Octopus Deploy
item.description: My current project has reached the point where we have to manage our infrastructure in a more organized way rather than ad-hoc manual configurations. Current landscape We use a pretty standard setup for a .NET web application. We keep our code in one monorepo hosted in internal GitLab. We use TeamCity to build our code and we use Octopus Deploy to run our deployments to Azure. We have several environments (let’s call them feature, test, and prod) and they all are different.
